intro: Randia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile randia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Randia sessilis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
